adjective.description: Present or existing from the beginning; first or earliest.
examples: the original owner of the house

adjective.description: Created directly and personally by a particular artist; not a copy or imitation.
Not dependent on other people's ideas; inventive and unusual.

noun.description: Something serving as a model or basis for imitations or copies.
examples: the portrait may be a copy of the original
one set of originals and four photocopies
he was one of the true originals

origin: Middle English (the earliest use being in the phrase original sin): from Old French, or from Latin originalis, from origin- (see origin).
